Articles.Content:
My computer's motherboard died today.

Power supply works fine, everything else works, but it can't boot.

Guess I'm going to have a bit of a stall.

damn, i thought this was about motorcycles

so is there an error message or is it just dead?

As Nuke said.

Especially (if it doesnÃ‚Â´t even get to the point where something is displayed on the screen) are there any POST beeps?
I suppose the silver lining is the 9 series chipsets are out now, so if you're an Intel man you can get a nice future-proof mobo.

Okay this is weird, but false alarm.

I took the entire computer apart, every wire, every fan and part.

Plugged it all back in, and it worked.

In fact, the CPU runs like, 15 degrees colder. (Fahrenheit)

Whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger I guess.
you probibly just had a case of unseated parts. the "wiggle it" technique usually works here.
